title: Launcher crashing on startup
body:
I tried to open up the league today and everything appeared to be normal. The icon came up as always and I waited. I waited forever and nothing happened -_-
Then the transparency over it turned to black and upon clicking it, it gave me the not responding error.

I've been trying to fix this for 2 hours by now, and I've already tried the following:
> Ran the launcher as admin, used both run as admin and lol.launcher.admin
> Copying RADS to another place and redownloading the installer and setting the path to another place
> Disabling UAC, reseting winsock, restarting my PC 100 times, checking my network 200 times
> Enabling gamer mode in ESET (dunno if it has any effects at all)
> Downloading the hextech repair tool and trying to reinstall and stuff
> Used a VPN

And NONE of them worked.
So, any ideas on what my problem can be? Server status shows everything is online (except Nemesis Jax :/ )

TLDR Patcher is not starting at all.
Thanks for putting time into reading this.

replies.body:
So, it appears it comes and goes.

The same day after 7 hours of trying for basically nothing it finally came up after just one random restart. I think the only way to deal with it is patience, it should do.
However I have the same issue right now, again.

@Targon I've been through that link also. Never submitted a ticket though.
I'll try using the hextech repair tool to disable firewall and turn off ESET manually. Will tell the results.
(A FEW MINUTES LATER)
Doesn't work at all. Same issue.

One thing: it was supposed to crash, but now it doesn't even show the logo, it's now the same ol' RADS error.

I've tried changing my DNS to 8.8.8.8 and Alternative DNS to 8.8.4.4, tried flushing my DNS, reseting winsock again, restarting 5 times, used a VPN, disabling ESET and my firewall and most importantly, waited a long time. No changes at all.

Any ideas now? :3 Answered late because couldn't find my thread :/ I'm not used to these board system.

There could be a number of configurations that may be causing the problem. First, I'd recommend disabling ESET completely to see if it's blocking League entirely, even if exceptions for League are added. If that quick change doesn't resolve the issue, I suggest ensuring your local network settings are all compatible with League by working through our [connection troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues).

Let me know if those steps caused any change.
